title: Faultless Hotel - We will be back!
review: Hotel   The hotel was quite large with approx 100 rooms in a variety of bulidings spread over a large area with lots of space left open for lovely gardens and playing areas with no high rise buildings in sight the majority of the building are in a sort of alpine style. The hotel was extremely clean and the grounds, buildings and gardens were constantly being cleaned during our stay and there were no problems with bugs or the like.  The range of nationalitys at the hotel was the most varied I have ever come across and not a problem at all. English, Scots, Welsh, Germans, Moldovans, Russians, French, Dutch, Turks, Belgians off the top of my head although I would say the majority of guests are German.  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------…

title: Lovely hotel
review: Stayed for one week at the end of June with a child aged 8. Lovely clean and spacious rooms with 2 bedrooms and kitchen area and good sized balcony (we were upgraded to a suite which was possibly a self-catering unit in past times.) The food was of a good quality HOWEVER we went to book our restaurant reservations on Day 2 and there was no availability for either restaurant so please book early. ALSO the Thomas Cook brochure claimed the galas were weekly. Technically they are but actually alternate one week for the hotel, one week for the apartments so we missed out. So, coming back to the food, yes it was good but it did get rather tedious for breakfast, lunch and dinner. If we'd managed to break this up with the restaurant reservations then I'm sure I'd be singing from the…

title: Good value
review: Hotel is very convenient with families, especially with children.  There is sandy beach with a warm sea, that is not getting deep very quick. We stayed in a family room, and enjoyed the beach, food, service and the place very much.

title: lovely but male staff rude
review: melas holiday village is extremely clean staff cleaning inside and out all day long .we were very lucky as we were given a brand new room which was lucky .spoke to another english couple who had old room not very good the whole place is shutting for five months to make improvements .the resort seems to be full of germans and russians who are extremley rude hardly any english people .the male staff fawn over them speaking  to them in german and russian because of big tips .they speak little english .had to wait and wait for drinks with meals and plates to be cleared for next course .we found female staff cleaners etc extremley polite .we were extremley lucky to go to gala dinner which was wonderful and free not on every week though more like a banquet with show and live band and…

title: clean and tidy but  room for improvement
review: MY husband and eight of our family returned today from melas, We had stayed there about five years ago and thought we would take the family as a treat for my 50th birthday, we thought we would stay in the hotel part as a speacil treat, but before we had unpacked we knew it was a bad idea. The room where old and had bad aircon, we were told we could not use the main pool only the hotel pool and the slides pool'  When we went to look at the hotel pool, we were shocked it was nice but very quiet and hardly any sunbeds, We just knew the hotel was not going to work for us, we went to complain and explained about my birthday and that nine of us would never get a sunbed by the pool, We said we had been there before and could we downgrade to the village , They did this, and we where put…

title: Room for improvement
review: Stayed at the Melas holiday village in May. Found the resort to be clean and the food of a good standard . Perhaps not as much choice as other Hotels of similar standard that we have stayed in in Turkey . We did use the fish restaurant which you could use once as part of the all inclusive deal this was in the sister hotel next door. This turned out to be a bad choice . The food was not as good as in the main dinner we had been using and they served each course only when everyone had finished the previous course .So we were all waiting for the slowest dinner to finish and people stared to walk out as they got tired of waiting. The resort has a strange system in regards of the pool towels .They give you one per person but if you want a clean one after your swim they will charge…

title: Paradise at a nice price!
review: We stayed at the Melas Holiday Village in Side this September (13th to 20th) travelling with Thomas Cook. The flight out was something of a nightmare (to be reviewed separately!), having been delayed by 8 hours. However, the holiday itself did not disappoint.  We arrived after 11pm with the flight being delayed, and the hotel where efficient and courteous on our arrival, checking us in quickly and driving us by buggy to our rooms. They also provided us with a meal at that late time as we hadn't eaten for some time.  The village is set around a steep sided valley with accomodation set in small blocks (max 3 storeys high) around the top and sides of the valley. The valley centre is landscaped with gardens. The pool complex is split in two with a water park at the top and a…

title: OK
review: We stayed for a week in the Holiday Village ealier this year. I was expecting small villa style accomodation in the village but it turned out to be a Youth hostel style style large accomodation block with lots of rooms in. It was really noisy in the morning when people were getting up and the beds were rock hard. Other than that the room itself was quite nice with a large balcony overlooking the pool.  Hotel and grounds very clean. The food was great and staff were fairly attentive. The drinks service is a bit hit and miss and they do seem to favour serving large groups of Germans first.  The main downside to the village is that there is not much to do in the evening. The animation team shows are Ok for kids but not really for adults. There are a small number of seats in the…

title: Excellent :)
review: Me and my boyfriend went to this hotel in August 2010 and it was an amazing holiday. The people that worked there were very helpful and friendly and the hotel was kept generally clean. The food was amazing and there was so much choice at breakfast, lunch and dinner. There are shops right outside the hotel and we also walked into Side in the evening. We also went to the Managvat market which was very crowded but great for bargains. There weren't many English but we didn't have a problem with the other people staying there, and there were also a lot of cats around the hotel but we didn't find these a problem either. You can pay in Euros or Lira at any shop or in the market. There was never a 'fight' for the sunbeds which was lovely, we even went to the pool at 2 in the afternoon…

title: absolutely fantastic
review: First time to Turkey with myself husband daughter and 3 grandchildren ages 5 7 8 it aws absolutely fantastic beautifull grounds excellent food very clean and friendly childrens enetainment great and exceptional animation team good shows very professional and garla dinner 1 night was out of this world the only down side not a lot of English but all i can say is that is your loss missing out on a fantastic holiday will be back next year

title: absolutely brill
review: It was the first time of staying in the Melas holiday village, could not fault any part of the holiday,  from the moment we step into the lobby the staff were very friendly and helpful.  Food was out of this world, waiters were always on hand to keep your glass top up.   overall i would go back again.  There are lovely sights to see. The only downside was that there was a lot of Germans, but they were no bother to us, so were very friendly.

title: excellent  holiday
review: First time to Turkey the whole holiday was brilliant ,food , accommodation and staff.Only downside was mainly German visitors ,but we still had a great time .Would recommed this holiday village ,location beautiful. would go back again .

title: Good stay in a great part of Turkey
review: Have holidayed last three times in Egypt - this is what we were comparing this to.  Food - Good, a bit samey but no stomach upsets which is unusual for us  - we ate out a night just to vary it a bit as well - some lovely choices in Side town. With a 1 week stay you get 1 a la carte, Turkish v. nice.  Location - Terrific, great beach, near shops, 25mins walk into town on a lovely new esplanade - easy to get a taxi if you can't face walking back. Side very good - ruins, harbour a really nice touch - more than just faceless hotels.  Room - bit dated, small, but clean and adequate. The sister hotel next door is more glam. This is more family / simpler but we liked it - seemed friendlier.  Service - Generally very good, nice atmosphere, helpful, much better service at the bar than we…

title: Great holiday from start to finish
review: Have just returned from a week at the holiday village.  The hotel and grounds are well maintained and the whole complex was spotless at all times. The food was excellent and meals and snacks are provided up to midnight so there is a good choice. The drinks are served by waiter service so there is no queuing at the bar for ages like some all inclusive hotels. The rooms were clean and tidy and the maid service was excellent. The entertainment in the complex is about average for turkey with pool and beach games in the day and a show followed by the disco in the evening. There are shops and bars about 2 minutes walk away or you can get the bus to the nearby town of Side if you get bored of being in the hotel.

title: Amazing
review: I Would recommend this hotel to everyone, this was our second time here and it was as good as the last year! No faults! 10/10!

title: Nice Holiday
review: I have just returned from 2 weeks at the Melas Holiday Village with my wife and 7 year old Daughter . I arrived at the village at 05.30 am to be greeted by a very efficient reception desk which was pleasing after a long journey and hassle that we encountered at Stanstead airport. We were quickly taken to our apartments by a man in a super charged golf buggy who assisted with transfer of luggage and tried to communicate the fact we had air-conditioning and a mini bar in the room. After 30 seconds he lingered and i thanked him but he still lingered. Again i thanked him then realised he was after a tip so i explained i would see him later as i had no Turkish money on me at the time. Eventually he left. We had favoured a sea view room which would have been excellent if the tree 10…

title: great holiday
review: Myself and my daughter have just returned from a weeks holiday at the melas holiday village which was for my daughters 21st birthday. The accomodation was excellent set in spacious gardens and the maid service second to none. It was our first time all inclusive and we were surprised by the standard of food the amount and how well presented it was. All the staff at the village from were so helpful and friendly. The animation team were amazing and without them the holiday would not have been the same they work so hard 6days a week and always have time to stop and chat or give you a smile and a wave Rose is the most adorable person i have ever met. Most nights there is a show of some kind and sometimes afterwards a dance party by the pool although this finishes at 11.30pm  there is…

title: brillant holiday village
review: We have recently returned from the Melas Holiday Village. 2 families (4 adults, 2 children). Must say it was a brilliant holiday. the children loved the water park which is centered by the village rooms we were in.  The food was exellently prepared but would agree it would do the waiters no harm to smile once in a while. The odd one or two were ok but it isn't something that would spoil a holiday. Mostly ate in the restaurant but late lunch of burgers, spagetti and pizza down by the main pool where animation team centered the activities. Lady down by beach also makes wraps with filling from 12-4pm which were lovely. Watched a few of amination team entertainment at night, mostly mimed but a lot of work was put in to the productions and some good shows. We stayed for 2 weeks and…

title: Melas Holiday Village Good for Families
review: We recently returned from the Melas Holiday Village and had a lovely time (4 adults 2 kids), weather very hot with only a slight  breeze over the pool area.  The waterslides were very good for  kids and adults (trouble keeping them off them) the waterslides open at 10am until 12.30pn, they open again at 2pm until 5pm, ice cream is available from 12pm until 5pm onwards (which is a life saver, can go up as many times as you like), their is a small bar situated here which only serves drinks, need to be down before 9am to get a sunbed (unless you speak nicely to the pool man he is more than happy to reserve a bed for you).  Breakfast, lunch and dinner was served in the main restaurant  (waiters could do with smiling, which is more or less catered for the German's, Russians & Dutch…

title: Would return to the Melas
review: We have recently returned from this resort. We all had a wonderful time and our children (aged 8 and 3) cried when we left, making us promise to return.  We had a family room. This meant that we had our room with double bed and an interconnecting room for the children with two separate singles. The bathroom was nice, with a powerful shower over a bath. The balcony was a good size, overlooking the immaculate grounds. Our maid was efficient and very friendly. She came everyday and left towel art on several occasions.  As we were staying in the village part of the resort, as opposed to the hotel, we could use the main restaurant and the pool snack bar.  We ate in the restaurant for breakfast and our evening meal. There was a good variety of food, which was always well-cooked. There…

title: Perfect!
review: After much searching on the internet for a good price/quality hotel, we booked our holiday at the Melas Holiday Village for a week at the end of October 2007 (we just got back).  The Melas is definitely one of the best resorts we have stayed at. Our party consisted of parents, children and grandchildren, ranging in age from 2 to 60 and everyone had a great time.  The rooms are clean and modern. The restaurant is really excellent and all the food is freshly prepared. The sous-chefs are always walking around to check everything is ok. The staff are very friendly and help out however they can. There is a guest relations person called Nora who speaks Dutch, German, Turkish and English and she is really very helpful.  The beach is right on the doorstep and is very clean, with fresh…

title: Fantastic Holdiay Experience
review: Our family of five, with children aged 13, 11 and 5 have just returned from the Melas Holiday Village and we enjoyed a fantastic holiday.  The hotel service, food, animation, beach, pools and rooms were superb. We were a little unsure of what to expect given the wide range of reviews of Turkish hotels on various travel sites. The Melas was highly rated on both this site and several others that I had reviewed. The reviews were right on the money as this is a great resort.   We arrived on a Sunday and were treated to drinks at the bar and lunch while the staff prepared our apartment. The apartment was well appropriated with a refrigerator, two separate sleeping rooms and a modern bathroom. The only minor downside is that the apartment was a little small for five persons and there…

title: Relaxing Holiday
review: The hotel is definitely 5*.  It is extremely clean and the food was excellent.  There are several places to eat and all very good. The daytime activities were ok, however my children (15 and 12) would have been bored with the entertainment had they not made friends. The evening entertainment was poor.  It finished at about 10.30.  The disco opened at 11.00, but no atmosphere as noone ever went!  The shows were ok but finished far too early and we were left with nothing to do. Even though the hotel was excellent, i wouldnt go again purely because of the lack of entertainment.  So its a good job we were happy to have a relaxing holiday!!

title: Best Holiday i have ever been on!
review: Just yesterday i came back from my holiday at Melas Holiday Village. I must say, i have been on some pretty impressive holidays but this has got to be the best by far! I spent two weeks with my family, my mum my dad and my little sister, 12.   When we got there the staff were so friendly and just made you feel completely welcome.   There are three main pools in the village, the biggest one is were the animation team play games and entertain you throughtout the day.  The second pool is a little bit smaller and gets alot of sun, great if you want a tan. Beside it is also a small baby-pool.  Both of these have a lovely sea view.  The third pool is on the other side of the complex and is a water park with four waterslides and a lazy river.  Proberley the best part of my holiday was…

title: loved melas
review: We have just returned from Melas this morning and would definately recommend it. Absolutely fantastic! There were 5 of us in our party, ages ranging from 12 to 63. My 12 year old son was entertained all day long by the animation team who were all so friendly. Lots to do or you can just relax by one of the pools or on the private beach. The food was excellent and plentiful.Everywhere was extremely clean. All in all Melas was a great place to stay and we will definately be going back!
